Detailed Description

The class for learning n dimensionnal histograms.

unsigned int plLearnHistogram::get_n_parameters ( ) const
inlinevirtual

Returns the ACTUAL number of parameters.

It could be different from the number of parameters returned by get_parameters.

For example, the actual number of parameters of a N dimensional normal distribution is N + N*(N+1)/2 because the covariance matrix is symmetric.

Implements plLearnObject.

void plLearnHistogram::get_parameters ( plValues &  params) const
inlinevirtual

Returns all learnt parameters of the object (parameters passed to the distribution constructors when calling 'get_distribution').

This virtual method has to be implemented in all derived classes.

Implements plNonCndLearnObject.

template<typename T >

inline

Returns the probability table corresponding to the learnt distribution in the output parameter 'table'.

Supposes that 'table' has the exact size.

bool plLearnHistogram::internal_addPoint ( const plDataValues &  point,
plFloat  weight = PL_ONE 
)
protectedvirtual

Adds a point point with a given weight weight and updates the statistics.

This is an internal method, do not use it directly. Use add_point instead.

Reimplemented from plLearnObject.
